alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Knox; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 5:30PM CDT until May 16 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Knox County in east Tennessee... Southern Anderson County in east Tennessee... North central Blount County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Roane County in east Tennessee... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 629 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oak Ridge, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Alcoa, Farragut, Oliver Springs, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village and Halls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 373 and 399. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 108 and 117. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
